wikipedia_page.main: George Fergusson Wilson (25 March 1822 – 28 March 1902) was an English industrial chemist.

response: * George Fergusson Wilson (1822-1902) – industrial chemist, lived at Weybridge from 1863 until his death
* George Fergusson Wilson (1822–1902), English industrial chemist

Wilson was the son of the chemist George Fergusson Wilson. In 1887, he was sent by his professor Alfred Newton to study and collect birds in Hawaii. On his return he wrote Aves Hawaiienses (1890-1899) with Arthur Humble Evans, illustrated by Frederick William Frohawk.
